blogData.title: AI tools are transforming Indian healthcare, growth in the Translations Market   and more
blogData.description:
This week we take a look at how AI tools are helping to transform Indian
  healthcare, machine learning is being used to create new music, plus much more.
blogData.keywords: AI, translation, machine learning, linear TV, growth, Artificial Intelligence, prediction, youtube subtitles, video caption, youtube captions

data.richContent:
Welcome to the Weekly Roundup!

Each week we put together a list of articles featuring some of the most interesting ideas and news in the field. This week we take a look at how AI tools are helping to transform Indian healthcare, machine learning is being used to create new music, plus much more.

Read on to find out what’s been going on in the past week.

1. Why one media buyer is embracing programmatic linear TV

Linear television can be a tough nut to crack when it comes to advertising and brand reach, but Global director of media strategy at PHD Media, Nick Vernola believes new technology can hold the solution.
He sits down to explain why his agency have begun adding programmatic linear TV buying as an option for their clients.

Read more here

2. Mind, body and AI: High-tech tools using artificial intelligence are transforming Indian healthcare

Artificial Intelligence is set to dramatically improve the lives of both doctors and their patients in India. AI tools are currently in progress to be able to non-invasively screen for diseases such a Tuberculosis. Not only costing less money but time too.

Read more here

3. Study shows that the Translation Services Market is growing at an incredible rate

A recent study, undertaken by Verified Market Research has shown that “the Global Translation Services Market was valued at USD 38.04 Billion in 2018 and is expected to witness a growth of 2.02% from 2019-2026 and reach USD 44.67 Billion by 2026.”

The report focuses on growth rate, advances in translation technologies and strategies that are currently being used by the main current market players.

Read more here

4. Machine learning you can dance to!

“We aren’t just AI enthusiasts applying machine learning to music…We are musicians who want better tools for making music.”

Two MIT grad students, frustrated with the time it took to listen to music samples and find the best beats, have created an app that uses machine learning. Something that will arguably revolutionise one way to make music.

Read more here

5. How an AI trained to read scientific papers could predict future discoveries

A new system created by researchers has taught an AI to correctly predict and provide insights into data that is far beyond human capabilities. AI are becoming more independent, but fear not! Independency in this context will greatly benefit us as humans.

Read more here

Conclusion

The past week has shown great developments in technology, especially in the AI field where we are seeing just how beneficial AI technology is becoming for us around the world.

Please connect with us on LinkedIn, YouTube or Facebook for any comments, questions, or just to keep up to date with the work we do!

We are very grateful for your support!

If you haven’t yet and are interested in trying out our technology, please try our platform, or drop us an email at hello@videotranslator.ai.

nodes.title: VideoTranslatorAI Wins Feasibility Study for NSW Small Business Innovation & Research Program
nodes.description: VideoTranslatorAI wins NSW SBIR 2022 feasibility study, focusing on AI for healthcare in CALD communities. We are excited to contribute to a more inclusive healthcare in NSW.
nodes.coverAlt: VideoTranslatorAI Wins Feasibility Study for NSW Small Business Innovation & Research Program

nodes.description: Our journey with the Bushfire Commercialisation Fund, the power of positive feedback, and our next steps. #bushfiremitigation #resilience
